title.narrative: L'opération du HCR en la République arabe syrienne
UNHCR operation in the Syrian Arab Republic
عملية المفوضية في المملكة العربية السعودية

description.narrative: Cette activité montre les détails de l'opération du HCR en la République arabe syrienne pour 2022, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats.
This activity shows details of the UNHCR operation in the Syrian Arab Republic for 2022 including the budget, funding, expenditure and results.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.
المفوضية السامية للأمم المتحدة لشؤون اللاجئين هي منظمة عالمية تكرس عملها لإنقاذ الأرواح وحماية الحقوق وبناء مستقبل أفضل للاجئين والمجتمعات النازحة قسرًا وعديمي الجنسية

title.narrative: Operation Website
Information for Refugees, Asylum-seekers and Stateless People
UNHCR - The UN Refugee Agency
UNHCR IATI Overview
Latest News
Refugee Response Financial Tracking Dashboards
Syria Earthquake Joint Response 2023

description.narrative:
In the early morning of Monday the 6th of February, a major earthquake of magnitude 7.8, on the Richter scale hit southern Turkey and northwestern Syria. The earthquake caused a large number of casualties and widespread destruction to infrastructure and civilian buildings in both southern Turkey and Northern Syria. Just a few hours later, in the afternoon, a second earthquake of 7.5 magnitude was recorded, whose epicenter was also in southern Turkey. In addition, dozens of aftershocks of lesser intensity followed the initial earthquake and further damage is expected in the coming days.

This major humanitarian disaster calls for immediate action. All partners have presence on the ground and can scale up their response immediately. In light of the current crisis, we initiated the Acute Crisis Mechanism. This proposal focuses on multiple sectors.

title.narrative: FSC-I2 Availability of, access to and consumption of food
Number of people enabled to meet their basic food needs

description.narrative: Distribution of Ready to eat: EPDC: 7000 Individuals (1400HH) GOPA: 5000 Individuals (1000HH) Distribution of Regular FP: GOPA: 3250 Individuals (650 HH)

title.narrative: ACC-I1 Participation
Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme

description.narrative: Focus group discussions, Assessments, PDM surveys

title.narrative: WSH-I1 Hygiene promotion
Number of people having regular access to soap to meet hygienic needs

description.narrative: Hygiene kits: ZOA: 8330 Individuals (1666HH) - (overlapping with water trucking beneficiaries) GOPA: 5000 Individuals (1000HH) (overlapping with RTE beneficiaries)

title.narrative: WSH-I4 Water supply
Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use
LOC-I3 Capacity strengthening (reach)
Number of national and local actors supported with capacity strengthening
